review: great atmosphere one of the best villains in gaming history i could fix her altough i would prefer to obey her orders and fabulous gameplay in era when every month made a difference and led to another breakthrough it was years ahead of the competition even the cyberspace is perfect and while it made me question my life choices its still superior to any other hacking minigame
the level design is peak yall are tweakin

going through and finally playing classic games system shock was defiantly engaging and amazing game to play with that sci fi action horror vibe from movies form the 70s80s once you get used to the controls the game is a blast with intense combat as you check corners carefully as well as use your head to progress i went in blind and left impressed by what this classic had to offer
love to speed run this

this is real cyberpunk badassness creepy crazy shizz   wtf any game that doesnt have this kinda controls really sucks this has coolest controls and stuff  this is only game i know of with this amount of control depth

holy fucking shit  really really ahead of its time despite all the old jank really fucking fun i devoured this game

extremely surprised at how much level of detail is in this old game it feels very accessible too not sure about the stutter issue at first i had some mouse look screen tearing that went away after about a minute of the game being loaded plays fine thus far really enjoyable

honestly kino game so much soul and passion in this game  you have to get into it its not a modern easy to understand game  but its worth it in the end one if not the best antagonist in the gaming she is so much fun  f the cyberspace tho
system shock is the best game ive ever been introduced to by a friend thanks raiva

one of my favourite games of all time  seriously so fucking immersive and charming the remake is technically better but the 90s charm modability edward diego the secondary antag being an aspy nerd rather than a bond villain minigames and the fucking banger adaptive soundtrack this has over ss23
buy this game but do use a guide

still unmatched in atmosphere  depth and design philosophy alongside deus ex and thief this is a gem straight from the golden era of pc gaming  when the fun factor was just one slice of a pretty big cake this is a rough diamond  a complex book difficult to read  that changes you deeply the system shock experience can make you a different gamer  an aware one  and gaming will never be the same 10  10
a true classic  not as good as the follow up but still worth a playthrough
very fun game incredibly impressive for 1994 and the enhanced edition makes it easy to play in 2025 and beyond
not for the faint of heart but if you take your time to adjust to the control scheme there is a lot of fun to be had with the story puzzles and combat

at first both the interface and the controls feel complex but as you play you gradually get better at them and the game becomes incredibly fun its crazy that a 1994 game  which now makes it more than 30 years old is still so fun after all this time
for all true video game enjoyers who are sick of games designed by retards for the lowest common denominator of modern day gaming audience
gas game
its like doom in space but its a thinking and a strategy game all in glorious retro fps style

this game is awesome the gameplay is fun and the exploration is awesome too i love how the game is designed so much of this game is awesome dont get me wrong its confusing at first but thats why i love the game that learning curve of trying to understand what the fuck im looking at felt so great highly recommend though it is a bit cryptic at times so be aware of that

dont get me wrong i love this game that said i could not finish this version due to a movement bug that made me feel like i was playing an ice level at all times just emulate it or pick up it up on gog dont be like me for some reason i suffered through 9 hours of it before i decided to stop
great game with a horrible frame stutter when turning character if it ever changes i will update my review

this game gave me a headache the classic version has such clunky controls i could barely move thank god the enchanted edition lets you aim with a mouse  i like the atmosphere though with so much screen real estate being taken by the hud i get overwhelmed pretty easily otherwise its quite good beating cyborgs with a pipe is surprisingly calming
funfun
excellent shame i got hardstuck near end game and couldnt finish well system shock 2 here i go

fun and not too cryptic

an absolute blast to play through graphics and lack of direction be damned if youve ever wondered whats it like to be a lone wolf terminator on a quest to save humankind this is the game cybernetic upgrades huge range of weapons large enemy variety and of course the massively underrated soundtrack all come together in this groundbreaking title all the way back from 1994 to create a oneofakind unforgettable experience truly special game

i played this on windows initially and i didnt like the music so i turned it off and replaced it with lustmord on linux the music is busted by default so one less step to making this game perfect true classic love it

fantastic game that still holds up pretty well in my opinion  jank movement but once you get a feel of it its simple to understand same thing with the ui and how to maneuver the menus  i will be honest and say i had a guide with me in case i got stuck big time but for most of the time i had no guide in front of me  great gunplay good levels good music great antagonist  cant wait to try out system shock 2

insane graphics
